message: And yet no one cares. They've been playing this song since the Bush admin. Step one: place quote by anonymous source in paper of record (ie Wall St Journal). Step two: quote said paper of record (the Wall St Journal said today...) but leave out the context, turning anon source into quotable fact. Step three: repeat quickly and often. Step four: marginalize and ignore your critics. Your move, Media Matters.

I found out they fed my newborn a bottle of formula and """"some sugar water"""" right after delivery (had a c-section) even though I asked them to bring the baby to me for feeding, which I was completely able to do although inexperienced. Also, I asked for BF support the second day, but was told the woman was not available that day. Took a few tries but my baby & I finally figured it out on our own. A lot of stress could have been avoided with just a little support.

I'm assuming you were making a joke Tim, because withdrawing from Iraq and utilizing drone strikes has no correlation to a stronger military. If anything...between the force reductions, sustained ops tempo, ousting of an unprecedented # of senior leaders, softer/gentler training tactics, reduced training standards, conversion to civilian contractors in place of military bodies, our military is struggling. We might spend a lot of money, but the recent political oversight from congress and a president who have no clue how to run a military has severely weakened its ability. Less than 20% of congress has ever served, how would they know what's best for the military?
